00023 KSingleBoloSubRecord::KSingleBoloSubRecord(void)
00024 {
00025         InitializeMembers();
00026         
00027         //we must take care of members on the heap outside of 
00028         //InitializeMembers...
00029         
00030         fDetectorName=0;
00031         fDetectorNameSize=0;

00035 KSingleBoloSubRecord::KSingleBoloSubRecord(const KSingleBoloSubRecord &aRec)
00036 : KSubRecord(aRec)
00037 {
00038         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00039         fDetectorNameSize = 0;
00040         fDetectorName = 0;
00041         SetDetectorName(aRec.GetDetectorName().c_str(), aRec.GetDetectorNameSize());
00042 
00043 }

00045 KSingleBoloSubRecord& KSingleBoloSubRecord::operator=(const KSingleBoloSubRecord &aRec)
00046 {
00047         if(&aRec == this) return *this;
00048         
00049         this->KSubRecord::operator=(aRec);
00050         CopyLocalMembers(aRec);
00051         
00052         SetDetectorName(aRec.GetDetectorName().c_str(), aRec.GetDetectorNameSize());
00053         
00054         return *this;
00055 }

00067 KSingleBoloSubRecord::~KSingleBoloSubRecord(void)
00068 {
00069         //Does calling clear at destruction take too much computing time?
00070   Clear("C");
00071         
00072         //clean up 
00073         if(fDetectorName!=0){
00074                 delete[] fDetectorName;
00075                 fDetectorName=0;
00076                 fDetectorNameSize=0;
00077         }
00078 }
00079 
00080 void KSingleBoloSubRecord::Clear(Option_t *opt)
00081 {
00082         //Clear the base classes and then clear/delete any local
00083   //members. Its necessary for this Clear method to exist
00084   //in the case that instances of this object are stored
00085   //inside of a TClonesArray
00086   //Also, if this class holds any TClonesArrays, it must call
00087   //TClonesArray::Clear("C")
00088         KSubRecord::Clear(opt);
00089         
00090   //Clear and delete local objects here. 
00091         if(fDetectorName!=0){
00092                 delete[] fDetectorName;
00093                 fDetectorNameSize=0;
00094                 fDetectorName=0;
00095         }
00096         
00097   //Re initialize local members here and prepare for the next use of this class.
00098   InitializeMembers();
00099         
00100 }

00102 void KSingleBoloSubRecord::InitializeMembers(void)
00103 {
00104   //WARNING - THIS METHOD SHOULD NEVER ALLOCATE SPACE FOR POINTERS

00107         //SetDetectorName("",1);
00108         //SetVoie(-99);

00110         //SetHeatNegativeThreshold(-99);
00111         //SetTimeOfLastThresholdChange(-99);

00113 
00114 void KSingleBoloSubRecord::SetDetectorName(const Char_t* aWord, Int_t aSize)
00115 {
00116         if(aSize!=fDetectorNameSize){
00117                 if(fDetectorName!=0){
00118                         delete[] fDetectorName; 
00119                         fDetectorName=0;
00120                         fDetectorNameSize=0;
00121                 }
00122                 if(aSize>0)fDetectorName= new Char_t[aSize];
00123                 fDetectorNameSize=aSize;
00124         }
00125         if(aSize>0)memcpy(fDetectorName, aWord, fDetectorNameSize*sizeof(Char_t));
00126 }
00127 
00128 string KSingleBoloSubRecord::GetDetectorName(void) const 
00129 {
00130         string str=""; 
00131         
00132         if(fDetectorName==0) 
00133                 return str;
00134         
00135         else return str.assign(fDetectorName, fDetectorNameSize);
00136         
00137 }

00140 Bool_t KSingleBoloSubRecord::IsSame(const KSingleBoloSubRecord &aRec, Bool_t bPrint) const
00141 {
00142         //Compares two objects and their member variables to test for equality.
00143         //If bPrint is set to true, then a message for each member variable that is different
00144         //will print to standard out. Otherwise, this method will return false and quit
00145         //checking member variables as soon as it finds a unequal data member.
00146         
00147         Bool_t bIsEqual = true; //assume its true, then test for differences
00148         
00149         //call the base class's IsSame methods
00150         if(!this->KSubRecord::IsSame(aRec,bPrint)){
00151                 bIsEqual = false;
00152                 if(!bPrint)
00153                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00154                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00155         }
00156         
00157         if(fDetectorNumber != aRec.fDetectorNumber){
00158                 if (bPrint) 
00159                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fDetectorNumber Not Equal. lhs: " 
00160                         << fDetectorNumber << " != rhs " << aRec.fDetectorNumber << endl;               
00161                 bIsEqual = false;
00162                 if(!bPrint)
00163                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00164                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00165         }
00166         
00167         if(fDetectorNameSize != aRec.fDetectorNameSize){
00168                 if (bPrint) 
00169                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fDetectorNameSize Not Equal. lhs: " 
00170                         << fDetectorNameSize << " != rhs " << aRec.fDetectorNameSize << endl;           
00171                 bIsEqual = false;
00172                 if(!bPrint)
00173                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00174                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00175         }
00176         
00177         if(strncmp(fDetectorName, aRec.fDetectorName, sizeof(Char_t)*fDetectorNameSize)){
00178                 if (bPrint) 
00179                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fDetectorName Not Equal. lhs: " 
00180                         << fDetectorName << " != rhs " << aRec.fDetectorName << endl;           
00181                 bIsEqual = false;
00182                 if(!bPrint)
00183                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00184                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00185         }
00186         
00187         /*if(fHeatPositiveThreshold != aRec.fHeatPositiveThreshold){
00188                 if (bPrint) 
00189                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fHeatPositiveThreshold Not Equal. lhs: " 
00190                         << fHeatPositiveThreshold << " != rhs " << aRec.fHeatPositiveThreshold << endl;         
00191                 bIsEqual = false;
00192                 if(!bPrint)
00193                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00194                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00195         }*/
00196         
00197         /*if(fHeatNegativeThreshold != aRec.fHeatNegativeThreshold){
00198                 if (bPrint) 
00199                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fHeatNegativeThreshold Not Equal. lhs: " 
00200                         << fHeatNegativeThreshold << " != rhs " << aRec.fHeatNegativeThreshold << endl;         
00201                 bIsEqual = false;
00202                 if(!bPrint)
00203                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00204                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00205         }*/
00206         
00207         /*if(fTimeOfLastThresholdChange != aRec.fTimeOfLastThresholdChange){
00208                 if (bPrint) 
00209                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fTimeOfLastThresholdChange Not Equal. lhs: " 
00210                         << fTimeOfLastThresholdChange << " != rhs " << aRec.fTimeOfLastThresholdChange << endl;         
00211                 bIsEqual = false;
00212                 if(!bPrint)
00213                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00214                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.
00215         }*/
00216         
00217         /*if(fVoie != aRec.fVoie){
00218                 if (bPrint) 
00219                         cout << "KSingleBoloSubRecord fVoie Not Equal. lhs: " 
00220                         << fVoie << " != rhs " << aRec.fVoie << endl;           
00221                 bIsEqual = false;
00222                 if(!bPrint)
00223                         return false;  //if we're not printing out, just return false at first failure
00224                 //the operator== method uses this functionality.

00226
